default.location: unset SEDFILE unsetenv SEDFILE set SEDFILE = $SED
default.script: set tmp = ( $(CONTENT) ) set fname = $tmp[$#tmp] echo "running sed on $fname to produce $fname.sedfile_tmp" set echo $SEDFILE -e $(CONTENT) >! $fname.sedfile_tmp || exit 1 unset echo echo "mv -f $fname.sedfile_tmp $fname" mv -f $fname.sedfile_tmp $fname || exit 1

set echo set unixdiff_fail = 0 set tmpL = ( $(CONTENT) ) if ($#tmpL >= 2) then # assume that the last two arguments are the files to be compared # and check for their existence @ i = $#tmpL - 1 if (! -e $tmpL[$i]) then echo "*** unix diff file $tmpL[$i] does not exist" set unixdiff_fail = 1 endif @ i = $#tmpL if (! -e $tmpL[$i]) then echo "*** unix diff file $tmpL[$i] does not exist" set unixdiff_fail = 1 endif endif if ( $unixdiff_fail == 1 ) then set have_diff = yes else $DIFF $(CONTENT) $DIFF $(CONTENT) >! diff.out || set have_diff = yes set tmp = ( `$WCBYTES diff.out` ) if ( $tmp[1] > 0 ) then set have_diff = yes echo "Unixdiff: check diff.out?" endif endif unset echo

set echo set tmpL = ( $(CONTENT) ) if ($#tmpL != 2) then echo "*** wrong number of arguments to the <execute name=nlinesdiff> block" exit 1 endif set nld_name = $tmpL[1] set nld_maxnlines = $tmpL[2] set nld_nlines = "`cat $nld_name | $WCLINES`" if ( $nld_nlines > $nld_maxnlines ) then unset echo echo "*** nlinesdiff: number of lines in file $nld_name = $nld_nlines is greater than allowed = $nld_maxnlines" set echo set have_diff = yes endif unset echo
